name: Average Fiddler on the Roof Quiz | 15 Questions | Movies

questions.text: Name one of Tevye's three oldest daughters.
questions.explanation:
Hodel & Tzeitel & Chava.

	He has two other younger daughters named Schprintze and Bielke.

questions.text: What is the name of the village Tevye lives in?
questions.explanation:
Anatevka.

	In the original stories of Sholom Aleichem, which 'Fiddler on the Roof' is based on, the family does not live in Anatevka, but on a farm nearby.

To life.

	Lazer Wolf and Tevye sing a rousing song with this title to celebrate the engagement of Lazer to Tevye's daughter Tzeitel.

questions.text: Where does Yente decide to go at the end of the movie?

questions.explanation:
Leonard Frey & Frey.

	Richard Dreyfuss, John Ritter, and Rob Reiner all auditioned for the same role, but in the end, the part went to Frey, who played it on Broadway.

Golde.

	She is played by Norma Crane, who, tragically, died only a year after 'Fiddler on the Roof' was completed.

questions.text: What is the name of the beggar?
When Perchik gets arrested, where is the settlement that he is sent to?
Which song reprises itself several times throughout the movie?
options: If I Were A Rich Man
questions.explanation:
Tradition.

	The entire movie is based on the Jewish traditions disappearing. The fiddler represents the enduring spirit of the Jewish people.

questions.text: Who directed and produced 'Fiddler on the Roof'?
Who does Chava fall in love with that makes Tevye disown her?
questions.explanation:
Fyedka.

	Tevye disowns her because Fyedka is not Jewish.

questions.text: Who does the family go and live with in America?
questions.explanation:
Uncle Avram.

	He lives in New York.

questions.text: What was the name of Lazar Wolf's deceased wife?
What was Motel saving up to buy?
Who agrees to dance with Perchik at Motel and Tzeitel's wedding?
questions.explanation:
Hodel.

	This breaks the tradition of keeping men and women separated at weddings.
